pain_points_original.title: Unclear AI Transformation & Procurement Strategy
pain_points_original.description: DPC aims to use AI to transform government services but lacks a clear understanding of the market, viable use cases, and how to structure future procurement and policy to achieve these goals.

pain_points_original.title: Securing Sensitive Data in AI Solutions
pain_points_original.description: A critical challenge is adopting powerful AI tools, especially those using external LLMs, while ensuring strict compliance with security and privacy policies to safeguard sensitive government data.

pain_points_original.title: AI Integration with Legacy Government Systems
pain_points_original.description: DPC is concerned with the risk of integrating new AI solutions with existing government systems, focusing on the maturity, scalability, and adaptability of vendor solutions to ensure seamless operation.

pain_points_original.title: Forecasting AI Investment and Budgeting
pain_points_original.description: Lacking clear cost models for AI technology, DPC cannot effectively plan future budgets or build the financial business case required for long-term, strategic investment in AI adoption.

merge_decisions.merged: Securing Sensitive Data in AI Solutions
AI Integration with Legacy Government Systems

pain_points_final.description: DPC aims to use AI to transform government services but lacks a clear understanding of the market, viable use cases, and how to structure future procurement and policy to achieve these goals.
